question: You live in a room in a college where you share it with another student. You find it very difficult to study and work there because your roommate always has friends visiting. He/she has parties in the room and sometimes borrows your things without asking you.Write a letter to the Accommodation Officer at the college and ask for a new room next term. You would prefer a single room and explain your reasons.You should write at least 150 words.
text: I am writing this letter to reach out for help from you regarding my accommodation.

I am sharing Room 408 with my classmate Amy in the Hall of Residence. However, the behaviours of Amy have caused several serious troubles for me. First of all , she invites some friends to our room to have a party on a regular basis. They cause a lot of noise, drink beer and make mayhem until midnight, which is uninstalling and annoying. In addition, they eat my food without noticing me so many times, although I have told them not to do that. I am unable to stand that.

I would be grateful if you could offer me a single  quiet room next semester. I take my studies so seriously as I would like to graduate with decent qualifications, which makes me more employable. If I live in this environment, I cannot sleep well at night, which is devastatingly harmful to my academic performance.
I am looking forward to your reply.
